meanings.definition: A large predatory fish found in North American waters.
meanings.sent1: The jackfish swam swiftly through the river.
meanings.sent2: I saw a massive jackfish while fishing at the lake.
meanings.sent3: The jackfish told jokes to the other fish in the sea.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as fierce as a jackfish hunting its prey.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering scales of the jackfish glistened in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: We decided to jackfish at the nearby pond.
meanings.sent2: He loves to jackfish early in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The friends planned to jackfish together for the first time.
meanings.sent4: She hoped to jackfish a big one to show off.
meanings.sent5: Jackfishing requires patience and skill to be successful.

meanings.definition: The flesh of a jackfish, used as food.
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a delicious meal using jackfish.
meanings.sent2: I tried jackfish for the first time and loved it.
meanings.sent3: The cat sneaked a bite of the cooked jackfish.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the grilled jackfish filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: Jackfish is a popular dish in coastal towns.
